title.narrative: 209 EMERGENCY / DISASTER RISK REDUCATION (DRR)

description.narrative: UNICEF COs and partners are supported by ROSA to have strengthened emergency preparedness plans and response to natural hazards and man-made crises robust security, risk/safety management and effective strategies for disaster risk reduction and climate change adaptation that contribute to resilience building via risk-informed programming.

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 5815 Lekhnath Marg Kathmandu Nepal

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF COs and partners are supported by ROSA to have strengthened emergency preparedness plans and response to natural hazards and man-made crises; robust security, risk/safety management and; effective strategies for disaster risk reduction and climate change adaptation that contribute to resilience building via risk-informed programming.

description.narrative: Substantial contributions were made in global policy and strategy setting (incl revision of CCC, Humanitarian Review, ea) to include regional perspectives and are rolled out. A regional framework for Linking Humanitarian and Development programming is developed and applied in select COs. Strategic advice and technical support is provided to COs on COVID 19 response yet also for other emergencies (Rohingyas crisis, cyclones, floods, droughts ea). EPR capacity building in COs continue, Emergency training by program sections are supported and the Regional Rapid Response Mechanisms continues to be refined. Investments are made in Emergency Preparedness through Platform strengthening. Progress on track. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:14/08/2020

title.narrative: Response rate to support COs with UNDAFs, Country Programme Documents, Mid Term Reviews, Strategy Notes ensuring at least one DRR and EPR key strategy
Number of country offices compliant with risk informed programming benchmarks
Number of partnership agreements and or Memorundum of Understanding documents signed with partners
Number of country offices benefit from Global policy and strategy setting and roll out (ie CCC, framework for linking humanitarian and development programming )
Number of country offices assisted in coordination of cross sectoral COVID emergency response planning, implementation M&E, advocacy and fundraising
Number of country offices with improved technical capacity in DRR
Number of country offices supported in strengthening EPR, DRR and/or GRIP capacities including through various capacity building workshops and trainings
Number of country offices that are supported to ensure quality control and fulfill EPP benchmarks as per roll out plan
Number of country offices receiving strategic advice and technical support to ensure timely and quality disaster response in a consoldiated cross sectoral manner.
